description: Create .NET 10.0 solution with Lopen.sln, Directory.Build.props, and Directory.Packages.props
notes: Foundation â€” nothing else can proceed without a buildable solution

description: Create CLI entry point project (src/Lopen/) with Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting and System.CommandLine
notes: Main executable project with DI container, root command, --help, and --version

description: Create class library projects for each module (Core, Llm, Storage, Configuration, Auth, Tui, Otel)
notes: Empty class libraries with correct inter-project references per dependency graph

description: Create xUnit test projects for each module and add to solution
notes: Tests must pass with dotnet test from solution root

description: Add .editorconfig and verify dotnet format --verify-no-changes passes
notes: Code formatting must be enforced from the start

description: Add .lopen/ to .gitignore along with standard .NET build artifacts
notes: .lopen/ contains ephemeral session state, not project source

description: Update Dockerfile to match new solution structure and verify dotnet build succeeds
notes: Existing Dockerfile references dotnet build but no solution exists

description: Implement built-in default settings as strongly-typed C# configuration classes
notes: All settings from Configuration spec: models, budget, oracle, workflow, session, git, tool_discipline, display

description: Implement JSON configuration file loading from .lopen/config.json and ~/.config/lopen/config.json
notes: Uses Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.Json

description: Implement configuration hierarchy resolution (CLI flags > project config > global config > defaults)
notes: Higher-priority source must win when setting defined at multiple levels

description: Implement configuration validation with clear error messages for invalid values
notes: Invalid config must produce actionable error messages

description: Add unit tests for configuration hierarchy resolution and validation
notes: Test all 4 layers and precedence rules

description: Implement auth service interface abstracting Copilot SDK authentication
notes: Interface for device flow, token validation, status check, and logout

description: Implement environment variable authentication (GH_TOKEN and GITHUB_TOKEN precedence)
notes: GH_TOKEN > GITHUB_TOKEN > SDK-stored credentials

description: Implement device flow authentication for lopen auth login
notes: Delegates to Copilot SDK device flow; displays user code and verification URL

description: Implement lopen auth status command (authenticated/unauthenticated/invalid states)
notes: Queries SDK for current auth state, does not cache

description: Implement lopen auth logout with env var warning
notes: Clears SDK credentials; warns if GH_TOKEN/GITHUB_TOKEN still set

description: Implement pre-flight authentication check that blocks workflow on invalid/missing credentials
notes: Lightweight SDK call before entering any workflow phase

description: Implement automatic token renewal during active sessions
notes: Intercept 401/403, call SDK refresh, retry; if renewal fails treat as critical error

description: Implement auth error messages with what-failed/why/how-to-fix format
notes: Includes PAT permission guidance for invalid tokens

description: Add unit tests for auth precedence, pre-flight check, and error handling
notes: Test env var precedence, SDK delegation, error message format

description: Implement .lopen/ directory creation and structure initialization
notes: Create sessions/, modules/, cache/ subdirectories on first workflow run

description: Implement session state persistence (state.json) with workflow phase, step, task hierarchy
notes: Compact JSON format using System.Text.Json

description: Implement session metrics persistence (metrics.json) for token counts and premium requests
notes: Per-iteration and cumulative token counts

description: Implement session ID generation in {module}-YYYYMMDD-{counter} format
notes: Counter is monotonically increasing per module per day

description: Implement latest symlink management for most recent session
notes: Symlink at .lopen/sessions/latest pointing to most recent session

description: Implement auto-save triggers (step/task/phase completion, user pause)
notes: State saved after each significant action for crash safety

description: Implement session resume from .lopen/sessions/latest with resume/start-fresh options
notes: Supports --resume {id} and --no-resume CLI flags

description: Implement plan storage at .lopen/modules/{module}/plan.md with checkbox task hierarchy
notes: Plans updated programmatically by Lopen, not by the LLM

description: Implement section cache keyed by file path + section header + modification timestamp
notes: Cache invalidated when source file changes

description: Implement corrupted state detection and recovery (move to .lopen/corrupted/)
notes: Detect unreadable/malformed state files, exclude from resume, warn user

description: Implement session lifecycle management (create, complete, prune by retention limit)
notes: Completed sessions retained up to configured session_retention limit

description: Add unit tests for session persistence, resume, ID generation, and corrupted state handling
notes: Test crash-safe write, symlink management, session lifecycle

description: Implement root command (lopen) with TUI launch and session resume detection
notes: Starts TUI by default; offers resume if active session exists

description: Implement phase subcommands (lopen spec, lopen plan, lopen build)
notes: Each scopes to a workflow phase; plan/build error if no spec/plan exists

description: Implement auth subcommands (lopen auth login, status, logout)
notes: Delegates to Auth module; auth login --headless errors with GH_TOKEN guidance

description: Implement session subcommands (list, show, resume, delete, prune)
notes: session show supports --format (md, json, yaml)

description: Implement config subcommand (lopen config show, --json)
notes: Displays resolved configuration with source indicated per setting

description: Implement revert command (rollback to last task-completion commit)
notes: Errors if no task-completion commits or uncommitted changes exist

description: Implement global flags (--headless, --model, --prompt, --unattended, --resume, --no-resume, --max-iterations)
notes: Global flags available across all commands (where applicable per spec)

description: Implement headless mode behavior (plain text stdout/stderr, non-interactive, exit codes)
notes: Exit codes: 0 success, 1 failure, 2 user intervention required

description: Implement --prompt injection for headless and TUI modes
notes: Headless: inject into LLM context. TUI: populate input field for user review

description: Add integration tests for CLI command parsing, flag validation, and exit codes
notes: Test all commands parse correctly, invalid flags produce errors

description: Implement Copilot SDK client wrapper with authentication bridge from Auth module
notes: Wraps SDK invocation with Lopen's auth, model selection, and error handling

description: Implement per-phase model selection from Configuration module
notes: Each workflow phase can use a different configured model

description: Implement model fallback logic when configured model is unavailable
notes: Log warning, fall back to next available model, error if none available

description: Implement Lopen-managed tool registration with the Copilot SDK
notes: Register tools per workflow step; schemas follow SDK function-calling format

description: Implement read_spec tool handler (section-level document extraction)
notes: Returns only the requested section, not full document

description: Implement read_research, read_plan, and log_research tool handlers
notes: read_plan returns plan with task statuses; log_research saves to RESEARCH-{topic}.md

description: Implement update_task_status tool handler with oracle verification enforcement
notes: Rejects complete status unless preceded by passing verify_*_completion call

description: Implement get_current_context and report_progress tool handlers
notes: get_current_context returns workflow step, module, component, task

description: Implement oracle verification tools (verify_task/component/module_completion)
notes: Dispatch cheap/fast model as sub-agent within same SDK invocation

description: Implement system prompt construction (role, workflow state, step instructions, context, tools, constraints)
notes: Structured prompt assembled per SDK invocation

description: Implement token and cost tracking from SDK response metadata
notes: Track context window usage, premium request count, session totals

description: Implement context window budget management (truncation/summarization of lower-priority sections)
notes: When context exceeds budget, truncate or summarize lower-priority sections

description: Add unit tests for tool registration, handler execution, and prompt construction
notes: Test tool schemas, handler responses, prompt assembly

description: Implement specification scanner that discovers modules from docs/requirements/ subdirectories
notes: Scans for SPECIFICATION.md files with YAML frontmatter

description: Implement 7-step workflow state machine with phase tracking
notes: Steps: Draft Spec > Dependencies > Components > Select > Tasks > Iterate > Repeat

description: Implement re-entrant assessment that determines workflow step from actual codebase state
notes: Reads spec, checks plan/task tree, verifies claimed-complete items, determines correct step

description: Implement specification drift detection via section content hashing
notes: Hash spec sections per save, compare on resume, flag changes to user

description: Implement phase transition logic (human gate for spec>plan, auto for plan>build and build>complete)
notes: Only spec to plan requires user confirmation

description: Implement task hierarchy data model (Module > Component > Task > Subtask)
notes: State transitions: Pending > In Progress > Complete/Failed

description: Implement task state transitions with completion criteria enforcement
notes: Task only complete when implementation done, tests pass, oracle verification passes

description: Implement back-pressure Category 1: resource limits (budget warning at 80%, confirmation at 90%)
notes: Per-module token and premium request budgets; configurable thresholds

description: Implement back-pressure Category 2: progress integrity (churn detection, false completion prevention)
notes: Escalate after configured failure threshold; reject task complete without tool verification

description: Implement back-pressure Category 3: quality gates (acceptance criteria enforcement)
notes: Module and component completion blocked until acceptance criteria satisfied

description: Implement back-pressure Category 4: tool discipline (corrective instructions on wasteful patterns)
notes: Detect repeated file reads, same failing command; inject corrective instruction

description: Implement git auto-commit per task completion
notes: When git.auto_commit enabled, commit after each task with conventional message

description: Implement branch per module (e.g., lopen/auth, lopen/storage)
notes: Working branch isolates module work from main branch

description: Implement document management (section-level extraction for LLM context)
notes: Parse markdown headers, extract relevant sections, auto-track resources

description: Implement programmatic task status updates without LLM invocation
notes: Checkbox updates, status tracking done in code, not by LLM

description: Implement failure handling (inline display, self-correction, user intervention at threshold)
notes: Single failures: inline. Repeated (3+): prompt user. Critical: block and require action

description: Implement module selection (scan, list with state, user selection)
notes: List modules from docs/requirements/ with not-started/in-progress/complete state

description: Add unit tests for workflow state machine and phase transitions
notes: Test 7-step progression, human gate enforcement, auto-progression

description: Add unit tests for back-pressure enforcement across all 4 categories
notes: Test resource limits, churn detection, quality gates, tool discipline

description: Implement split-screen layout with activity (left) and context (right) panes
notes: Ratio adjustable 50/50 to 80/20 based on terminal width

description: Implement top panel (logo, version, model, context usage, premium requests, git branch, auth status, phase/step)
notes: Always visible; suppressible with --quiet or --no-logo

description: Implement main activity area with progressive disclosure (current expanded, previous collapsed)
notes: Scrollable, auto-scrolls to current activity

description: Implement context panel (task tree, component/module hierarchy, active resources)
notes: Real-time updates, numbered resource access (1-9)

description: Implement prompt area with multi-line input and keyboard shortcuts (Enter, Alt+Enter, Ctrl+P, Ctrl+C)
notes: Fixed at bottom with context-aware hints

description: Implement landing page modal with quick commands
notes: Dismisses on keypress; skippable with --no-welcome

description: Implement session resume modal with session details
notes: Arrow key navigation between Resume/Start New/View Details

description: Implement tool call display (file edits with diffs, command execution, test results, research)
notes: Progressive disclosure with expandable sections

description: Implement confirmation and error modals
notes: Confirmation: Yes/No/Always/Other. Errors: severity-based with recovery options

description: Implement diff viewer with syntax highlighting and line numbers
notes: Line numbers with +/- markers, context lines around changes

description: Implement module selection modal with arrow key navigation
notes: Shows module state (not started/in progress/complete)

description: Implement slash commands (/help, /spec, /plan, /build, /session, /config, /revert, /auth)
notes: TUI prompt-area shortcuts that invoke corresponding CLI commands

description: Implement visual design (semantic colors, unicode symbols with ASCII fallbacks, box-drawing borders)
notes: Support NO_COLOR env var, terminal color detection

description: Implement component gallery (lopen test tui) with all components and stub data
notes: Interactive gallery; components self-register; multiple visual states per component

description: Implement queued user messages during active workflow (delivered in next SDK invocation)
notes: Preserves fresh-context-per-invocation model

description: Add tests for TUI component rendering with stub data
notes: Verify all components render without errors using mock data

description: Implement OTEL trace instrumentation for all required spans (command, phase, sdk, tool, oracle, task, session, git, backpressure)
notes: Uses System.Diagnostics.Activity with lopen.* namespace

description: Implement OTEL metrics (counters: commands, tools, sdk invocations, tokens, premium requests, oracle verdicts, tasks, backpressure, git commits)
notes: Uses System.Diagnostics.Metrics with lopen.* namespace

description: Implement OTEL histogram metrics (sdk invocation duration, tool duration, task duration, command duration, oracle duration)
notes: Duration metrics in milliseconds tagged by relevant dimensions

description: Implement OTEL log export with ILogger and trace correlation (TraceId/SpanId)
notes: Log categories: Workflow, Sdk, Tools, Oracle, BackPressure, Session, Git, Config

description: Implement conditional OTLP export (activated by OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_ENDPOINT, silent when unset)
notes: No telemetry leaves process when endpoint not set; no export errors

description: Implement OTEL configuration settings (enabled, export endpoint/protocol, service name, signal toggles)
notes: OTEL env vars take precedence over Lopen config settings

description: Implement Aspire AppHost project for local development (aspire run launches dashboard + Lopen)
notes: Lightweight AppHost that references Lopen as project resource

description: Add tests for OTEL instrumentation (spans created, metrics increment, export activation)
notes: Verify span hierarchy, metric registration, and conditional export behavior

description: Implement lopen config show command with source indication and --json output
notes: Display resolved config with each setting's source (CLI/project/global/default)
